title: Hamilton Bay
text: Hamilton Bay () is a small <a href="bay">bay</a> at the mouth of <a href="Salomon%20Glacier">Salomon Glacier</a>, indenting the southeast coast of <a href="South%20Georgia%20Island">South Georgia</a> northeast of the mouth of <a href="Drygalski%20Fjord">Drygalski Fjord</a>. It was surveyed by the <a href="South%20Georgia%20Survey">South Georgia Survey</a> in the period 1951–57, and named by the <a href="UK%20Antarctic%20Place-Names%20Committee">UK Antarctic Place-Names Committee</a> for <a href="James%20E.%20Hamilton">James E. Hamilton</a> (1893–1957), Colonial Naturalist to the <a href="Falkland%20Islands">Falkland Islands</a>, who was seconded for service with the <a href="Discovery%20Investigations">Discovery Investigations</a>, 1925–28.
